borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>By reason of failing to provide adequately sized bedrooms at the proposed dwellinghouse, and failing to provide private external amenity space for the proposed flats, the application fails to demonstrate that the&nbsp;proposed residential units would provide an acceptable standard of accommodation.&nbsp; The merging of commercial and residential uses at the waste store is unacceptable. As such, the proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p style="background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; background-position: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-size: initial;">-&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policies D4&nbsp; and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP5, BP6, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policy DMD1, SP2 and SP3 of&nbsp; The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p><div><br></div>

<p>An inadequate quantum of cycle parking spaces have been provided for the proposed development, failing to&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">promote alternative, sustainable forms of transport, contrary to:</span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy T5 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy BR11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy DMT3 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<p>The applicant has failed to provide a suitable quantum of off-street car parking spaces for the proposed development. As such, the development may have an unacceptable impact on local highways, contrary to:</p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policies T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy BR11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">- Policy DMT3 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<div>On account of its scale, siting and design, the proposed development would result in&nbsp; an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers. In the absence of information provided, it has not been demonstrated that the proposed development would not have a detrimental impact on neighbouring amenity. As such the development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
CP3 of </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies BP8 and BP11 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, and DMD1 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></p></div>

<p class="MsoNormal">The proposed development, by reason of its siting, position,
bulk and massing and elevation design, fails to accord with the character and appearance of the application site or surrounding area and
will have an unacceptable impact of the street scene. The proposed development is contrary to:- National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC ,
2021); - Policies H2, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of
the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF
Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2 and DMD1 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission version, December
2021)<o:p></o:p></p>

<p>The development will&nbsp;result in the loss of a significant quantum of commercial&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="floorspace" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lieflhqhbvia49due" style="">floorspace</span>&nbsp;to the ground floor unit sited within a&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="neighbourhood" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lieflhqhp28ysttzf" style="">neighbourhood</span>&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="centre" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lieflhqgxxoitakl1" style="">centre, which the applicant has failed to adequately justify</span>. As such, it has not been demonstrated that the loss of&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="floorspace" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lieflhqfa00s3zpya" style="">floorspace</span>&nbsp;would not&nbsp;compromise the operation or viability of the existing commercial unit.&nbsp;The loss of commercial&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="floorspace" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lieflgwtovu3glqi2" style="">floorspace</span>&nbsp;in this location fails to outweigh the contribution of x2 dwellings. As such, the principle is not supported. The proposed&nbsp;development&nbsp;is contrary to:&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">- National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC , 2021); - Policies D1, GG1, E9, SD6 and SD8 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policies CE1 and CM5 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policy BE1 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies DME3 and SP2 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</span><br></p>
description: Demolition of existing rear single storey garages/workshop,  the construction of a three storey rear extension and loft  conversion involving the construction of a rear dormer extension including one roof light to the front to facilitate the conversion of the upper floors of 429 Porters Avenue into two flats (1x one bed and 1x two bed); and the Construction of a new detached two storey 3xbed dwellinghouse to the rear of the site.

constraints_details.result: Autostop, 429 Porters Avenue, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 4ND
